alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 2:47PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Talladega, southwestern Calhoun, central St. Clair and north central Clay Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 247 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Riverside, or near Pell City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Anniston, Oxford, Talladega, Pell City, Cobb Town, West End-Cobb Town, Lincoln, Riverside, Munford, Hobson City, Talladega Superspeedway, Anniston Regional Airport, Talladega Municipal Airport, Grant Town, Logan Martin Lake, Honda Manufacturing Of Alabama, Oxford Lake, Bynum, Camp Mac and Jackson Shoals. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central and east central Alabama.
